main event: An unidentified object was observed for 20 minutes on 12 August 1960, displaying vertical ascending motion before disappearing below the horizon.
interesting points: The observation included ground-radar and air-visual tracking,Weather conditions were clear with no wind,The estimated elevation of the object was approximately 45 degrees,The sighting lasted the full 20 minutes until the object vanished,The conclusions included possible satellite, missile, aircraft, or astronomical phenomena.
